meanings.definition: Sown beneath or among other crops.
meanings.sent1: The undersown seeds grew quietly under the tall corn plants.
meanings.sent2: The farmer planted undersown clover to enrich the soil.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky rabbit hid in the undersown field, waiting for the perfect moment to munch on the hidden veggies.
meanings.sent4: The undersown flowers peeked out like shy children in a crowded garden.
meanings.sent5: The undersown grass whispered secrets to the roots of the main crop, sharing nutrients and stories.
